intro: Baccharis herbacea, commonly known as slender baccharis, is a perennial shrub native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and along riverbanks. The plant features narrow, gray-green leaves and produces small, yellowish-green flowers in panicles during the spring and summer. Its adaptability to drought conditions makes it a valuable plant for xeriscaping and erosion control. The species is also used in traditional medicine for its purported anti-inflammatory properties.
